document.docTitle: Nocaracris bulgaricus Ebner & Drenowski 1930, comb. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Pamphagidae (Orthoptera: Acridoidea) from the Palaearctic Region: taxonomy, classification, keys to genera and a review of the tribe Nocarodeini I. Bolívar

Bulgaria , Alibotuschgebirge.
Syntypes :
♂ ♀ ( NHMUK , ZIN , MfN , NMW ).

; ibidem, 1♂, 1♀ (Paratypes of
Paranocaracris bulgaricus flavotibialis
) ZIN).

Distribution. Known from S. Bulgaria : Pirin, Slavyanka, Mesta Valley, Western and central Rhodopes, Kresna Gorge, N.E. Greece : Makedhonia, Drama, Kozani, Grevena, Ipiros , Ioannina, Thessalia , Larissa and the southern part of European Turkey : Tekirdağ , Ganos ( Fig. 843 ).

Remarks. This species was recorded from Turkey for the first time by Peshev (1965a: 77) as “European Turkey : Tekirdağ , Ganos, 800 m , 7.5.1913 , 2 males , 2 females , 1 female nymph, leg. I. Buresh”. Popov (2007: 289) included the European Turkey to its distribution, but it was not previously reported in the papers regarding Turkey since 1965.
